meanings.definition: Behavior, speech, or writing that is artificial and designed to impress.
meanings.sent1: Her constant use of big words was just one of her affectations.
meanings.sent2: His affectations of wealth were obvious to everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: She put on airs with her affectations, but we all knew she was just pretending.
meanings.sent4: The politician's affectations of sincerity fooled no one.
meanings.sent5: The actress's affectations of humility were seen through by the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of pretending or putting on a false appearance.
meanings.sent1: His affectations of happiness couldn't hide his true feelings.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his affectations of bravery and knew he was scared.
meanings.sent3: The child's affectations of being a superhero made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His affectations of confidence crumbled under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The student's affectations of understanding the topic were quickly revealed.

meanings.definition: An artificial trait or mannerism displayed to impress others.
meanings.sent1: Her affectations of sophistication were comical to those who knew her well.
meanings.sent2: He adopted affectations of intelligence to fit in with the group.
meanings.sent3: The dog's affectations of being a guard dog were quickly dispelled by his friendly nature.
meanings.sent4: The artist's affectations of eccentricity were part of his persona.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's affectations of authority were evident in every interaction.
